automata

Class LTL2WDBA

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismComponent
      • automata.LTL2WDBA

  • public class LTL2WDBA
extends PrismComponent

    Construction of weak Deterministic Büchi Automata for a fragment of LTL, based on the algorithm presented in Christian Dax, Jochen Eisinger, Felix Klaedtke: "Mechanizing the Powerset Construction for Restricted Classes of omega-Automata", ATVA 2007, LNCS 4762.

    The approach works as follows: First, we construct a DBA via a standard power set construction of the NBA for the LTL formula. Then, for the suitable fragment of LTL, it is guaranteed that either all states in a SCC in the DA can be made accepting or all can be made non-accepting (the "weakness" property of the DBA).

    Using the algorithm described in Christof Löding: "Efficient minimization of deterministic weak omega-automata", Inf. Process. Lett. 79(3), 2001, it is then possible to obtain a minimal automaton for the language via a DFA-based minimisation.

    This minimisation step is not yet included, but will be added in the future. Currently, we are using this construction to obtain DAs with AcceptanceReach that are suitable for the model checking of co-safety rewards. For further details, see Sec. 4 of Joachim Klein et al: "Advances in probabilistic model checking with PRISM: variable reordering, quantiles and weak deterministic Büchi automata", International Journal on Software Tools for Technology Transfer, 2017.

    TODO: Optimise for performance

    • Method Detail

      • cosafeltl2dfa

        public DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceReach> cosafeltl2dfa(SimpleLTL ltl)
                                                   throws PrismException
        For a co-safe LTL formula, construct a DFA (i.e., a DA with AcceptanceReach) with the additional property that every state that accepts the full language is accepting, i.e., that state s in F iff s |= Sigma^omega.
        Note: Does not check if the formula is actually syntactically cosafe, it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the formula corresponds to a cosafe language.
        Parameters:
        ltl - the ltl formula, has to
        Returns:
        a DA with AcceptanceReach
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • obligation2wdba

        public DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceBuchi> obligation2wdba(SimpleLTL ltl)
                                                     throws PrismException
        For an LTL formula in the obligation fragment, return a WDBA.
        Parameters:
        ltl - the LTL formula
        Returns:
        a weak deterministic Büchi automaton
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • toDFA

        private DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceReach> toDFA(DA<java.util.BitSet,? extends AcceptanceOmega> da,
                                                   java.util.BitSet goalStates)
        Generate DFA (i.e., DA with AcceptanceReach) with the underlying transition structure of da. The set of goal states should be upward closed, i.e., once a goal state has been reached, all successor states should be goal states as well.
        Note: da is destroyed during the transformation and should not be used afterwards.
        Parameters:
        da - the DA
        goalStates - the set of goalStates for the DFA.
        Returns:

      • ltl2wdba

        private DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceBuchi> ltl2wdba(SimpleLTL ltl)
                                               throws PrismException
        Perform the power set construction as described in "Mechanizing the Powerset Construction for Restricted Classes of omega-Automata", and determine whether the SCCs of the resulting automaton should be accepting or non-accepting.
        The resulting WDBA is only equivalent to the language of the LTL formula if the language of the LTL formula is WDBA-realizable.
        Parameters:
        ltl - the LTL formula.
        Returns:
        a weak deterministich Büchi automaton.
        Throws:
        PrismException
